greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of composite numbers <= n and relatively prime to n.
comment: 30 is the largest number n with the property that if 1 < k < n and k is relatively prime to n, then k is prime. In other words, a(30) = 0 and if m > 30, then a(m) > 0. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Dec 08 2012
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[ Count[ Select[ Range[ n ], GCD[ #, n ]===1& ], q_/;!(PrimeQ[ q ]||q===1) ], {n, 180} ]
xref: Cf. A048597 (indices where a(n) = 0), A048865 (number of primes p < n that are relatively prime to n).
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_
